Author: Alright#0419
Content:
@dimxy @Mihailo 
```
  {
    "funcid": "s",
    "txid": "b688049b059f6c4fd4819d5ac26bf04f66a994da5e40f4fdbc8db2cbc6714fe6",
    "vout": 0,
    "amount": "1000000",
    "askamount": "1000000",
    "origaddress": "RRbepNhmKmfFcWm3GuTqHxKY1VK1oTuLr6",
    "tokenid": "cf6b8197cc60a7584850de8659542fbba6d64d41fdfe199b273728748ecdb59e",
    "totalrequired": "1000000.00000000",
    "price": "1.00000000"
  },
  {
    "funcid": "S",
    "txid": "0dde6ae2e1305bed2ba54076983d187464c95d0803731d904e1eda95a629cde7",
    "vout": 0,
    "amount": "990",
    "askamount": "990",
    "origaddress": "RRbepNhmKmfFcWm3GuTqHxKY1VK1oTuLr6",
    "tokenid": "75ab46f823b2514f468a6132b52bfa463e1657ad9e83e65aaebbcdb822f8b56b"
  }
```
It's possible to overfill a tokenfillask. I don't see it as much of a problem, but this is the output of tokenorders now. I could see this breaking dapps that make the assumption that `"totalrequired":` and ` "price"` will always be there. Probably enough to just take note of it tbh

Author: Alright#0419
Alright#0419
Content: they seem to be in at least some cases

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: Those are different vouts.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: We introduced 2-eval vouts in this version

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Let me show you where I'm talking about, just a moment

Author: Alright#0419
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/5ae5375a2953a5a94e189292181c5da0f138a41e/src/cc/CCassetstx.cpp#L737

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
this line can be replaced with 
`mtx.vout.push_back(MakeTokensCC1vout(EVAL_ASSETS, received_assetoshis, mypk));`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: The result is still the same. I'm basically just wondering what the difference is between these two

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
Yes it might be replaced.
The difference is that in the first case tokens became in one-eval EVAL_TOKENS vouts, in the second case they are remained two-eval EVAL_ASSETS+EVAL_TOKENS vouts

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: first case tokens you would see in tokenbalance output

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: it is like the second case tokens remain tokenconverted

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: so using the first case MakeCC1vout we do not need tokenconvert back

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: I'll take a look at tokenfillask either

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the overfilling order thing can't be done via rpc commands. I set received_assetoshis to a static value for that to happen

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or rather I replaced received_assetoshis in those two vouts with a static value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
pushed a new update to jl777 branch that supports -ac_cclib=<name>
Jthis allows devs to make changes to a single file cclib.cpp and define a user defined CC that uses dynamic libraries so no need to even recompile komodod. this enables a separation of a user defined CC from komodod, yet is is part of komodod at runtime

For now, you need to go into src/cc dir and run ./makecclib to make the src/cclib.so file that will be searched for

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the -ac_cclib=<name> must match the MYCCLIBNAME that is defined at the top of cclib.cpp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the name specified in -ac_cclib must match the name inside cclib.cpp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a CClib_Dispatch function that is called for evalcodes 0x10 to 0x7f (reserved for user defined CC)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what this means is that without rebuilding komodod, you can make a new CC that is inside cclib.cpp (and whatever files linked in to cclib.so) to do validation. For now, only the validation is added. for constructing CC tx, some external process will be needed which can be done however the custom CC wants it to

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so for now, it is just a theoretical support for user defined CC, I guess we can make a pass through rpc that will invoke a custom CC rpc,but I leave that for someone else to do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ca333 is working on the build part, for now windows likely wont build at all

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "no need to even recompile komodod" is pretty amazing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a dynamic cclib.so library

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: name is verified to match the -ac_cclib name, if so any CC evalcode 0x10 to 0x7f are sent into the cclib for validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course if you dont update the cclib, the cclib.so wont be updated

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: dynamic loadable libraries, so = shared object

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that will make it easier for CC devs wanting to write custom things at the c/c++ level, great feature

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: cclib.cpp is compiled with same include files as main daemon, so has access to all the functions

Author: jl777c#5810
jl777c#5810
Content: now i got it so you can define all your rpc methods via data table

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course you need to handle the rpc request when it comes in, but now there is rpc access to the cclib

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: latest jl777 and FSM uses cclib.so, and maybe there are some build issues. if so report to ca333

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I will try to test it out on os x soon

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Is it possible to have an oracle search a record whether or not someone is dead. And if that someone is dead, a cc automatically transfers funds in wallet to their heirs?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Then you would no longer need to trust someone with your keys

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Problem would be to have a reliable source to prove one is dead I assume?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Oracle know you are dead > funds transferred to multisig notary (not kmd notary but a real life one) adress > people sign off on the death > funds released?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not use heir CC?
